news_header: Domestic energy prices are expected to rise by 5% from April, increasing household bills by £85 annually. A typical household will pay £1,823 per year. This rise coincides with increases in water and council tax bills.
news_original_title: Energy bills forecast to rise by £85 a year
news_text: The price cap is predicted to rise from £1,738, affecting 26 million households. Ofgem will announce the new price cap on February 25. Households have accumulated £3.8 billion in debt due to high energy prices, with average arrears of over £1,500 for electricity and £1,300 for gas. Experts suggest tips for managing energy use during warmer months.
